bill_title: revise certain provisions regarding the obstructing of a law enforcement officer, jailer, or firefighter.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding the obstructing of a law enforcement officer, jailer, or firefighter. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 22-11-6 be amended to read as follows: 22-11-6. Except as provided in § § 22-11-4 and 22-11-5, any Any person who, by threatening to use violence, force, or physical interference or obstacle, fails to cease any physical act if ordered to do so, such as running away, intentionally obstructs, impairs, or hinders the enforcement of the criminal laws or the preservation of the peace by a law enforcement officer or jailer acting under color of his official authority, or intentionally obstructs, impairs, or hinders the prevention, control, or abatement of fire by a firefighter acting under color of his official authority, is guilty of obstructing a law enforcement officer or jailer or firefighter. Obstructing a law enforcement officer, jailer, or firefighter is a Class 1 misdemeanor. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
